This is a slightly more old-school game than most of the zombie stomp shooters I have seen, such as Left 4 Dead or the like. The key to really playing this game well, something that seems lost on many games of this kind - you have to play as a team, or your entire group will become HAMBURGER. It's that simple - there are a variety of specialized roles, allowing for a lot of freedom in gameplay (something I found lacking in the L4D series bigtime, for one), it allows a lot of freedom for weapon and avatar choices, especially with the little DLCs that come with it. All in all - get the right group and you can really kick some zombie butt.
Killing Floor is an amazing co-op first-person shooter. Available for all operating systems, you're bound to have a good time playing this game. And it's even better with friends!

A very good game indeed. In this game you play on a team consisting of a few other players fighting to survive. I guess you could say you fight zombies, but at the same time the "zombies" are really mutants. After each round you can purchase weapons to help you defend against the mutants. I've had a good time playing it and I still do play it. I'd recommend it to people who like FPS/Zombie games.

I got into killing floor probably 3 years after it's release, I always saw it rearing some hideous circus geaks head my way every season with some sort of in your face, gut erupting event to run alongside the steam sale; but I always assumed it would be too dated to jump into and that Id get the newer fps of the time instead...
Eventually I picked it up for 2 bucks in a customer appreciation sale, and after an hour of playing grabbed a few copies for my buddies and ushered in some awesome times into our gaming lives!
This in your face FPS is a co op game where players must work together to survive wave after wave of zombie-ish beasties until eventually showing down with the main boss.
Earning money along the way to spend at the store between waves as well as leveling up a character help keep it all fresh and engaging and its even got a little british charm!
Gunplay is fun with no crosshair iron sight only aiming and headshots are very rewarding often offering a slow motion moment for the team leading to...more headshots!
With lots to unlock, great gameplay, steam workshop and a development team that has and continues to nurture the community dont let the games age fool you its badass!

6 player coop where your task is to eliminate all monsters. Wave after wave with breaks between to buy weapons and ammo.
7 classes each with strenghts and weaknesses that compliment each other. Leveling increases dmg/ammo/carrying capacity/discount/etc..
Heaps of weapons, loadouts only resctricted by weight. Weapons are bougth at trader which opens at random predefined locations on map. 
Cash is earned by killing/healing and can be shared with teammates.
Each speciman has special ability.

Learning curve is pretty steep, but the game is fair. Occaisonaly you get something to spawn just around the corner you just checked.
Coop is enforced loosly. No incapacitation or any similar bull**** just stick together if you want to live.

One of my all time favourite games.

Killing Floor is probably my favorite arcade-y zombie game out there right now, despite its age.

Killing Floor holds up really well, even today. The developers are still constantly adding new content and keeping the game fresh, with seasonal events that are fun and hard to pass up. The primary mechanic in this game is obviously to "kill", and it gives you a lot of really satisfying ways to do just that, and it's even better with friends! Whether you'd prefer to burn your enemies with crowd control flame weapons, take out the big zombies with you sharpshooter rifle, lock down doors and shoot shit with a shotgun, or keep your team healed in the middle of heated combat, there is a place and role for everyone.

The game can get a bit repetitive in long sessions, especially when you only play as one class, but the gameplay is still satisfying and intense enough to bring you back for more... Well, at least it did for me.

If you haven't already played kf, just pick it up in one of the sales. It goes super cheap all the time and it's definitely worth your time and money.

A great co-op survival shooter. Best if played with friends, so don't buy expecting great offline play. Fortunately the purchase of dlc weapons and characters is not necessary to be good at the game, and the more original story than the usual "unexplained zombie apocalypse" is a refreshing change, although you may see similarities between some enemies and those in L4D. Although it was released over 4 years ago, the graphics still look good, and the wide variety of weapons and classes, plus the season-anual updates and holiday events make for a fun and challenging co-op shooter that never gets old!
absolut das beste survival Horror Co-op game zum kleinen preis

Soo, if you´re a real zombie game fan, I would deffeintly recommend you go try this game out!

According to me its by far the best zombie game ever made, yet. There´s not even a single thing I dont like about it, its all good, clean and flawless fun! its pumped up with blood and gore, zombies and extreme fun! I´d recommend you go try this with a friend too! Being playing it for a year or two and never regret that I´ve bought it!

So what´s so great about this instead of some other zombie shit games?
First of all, its a sort of skill tree progress game where you gain xp for playing, and everytime you increase your level you gain some new features! There are also different weapons for each perk (perks are role players) and every perk has it own abilities and advantages, which will need you to think strategic different everytime. There are also a magnificent huge amount of different maps in this game! You´re even able to play thousands of custom maps and man.. It´s just getting better and better!

There are a midi selection of weapons, and if you´re in need of more fun you can always purcahse the community weapon pack which unlocks some few awesome ones too!

The game is 100% worth buying! Sure thing. At its price its totally insane good!

- For a game like this it deserves 4.5 starts out of 5! That´s for sure

Pros:
-Team dependent.
-Co-operative.
-RPG Elements.
-Seasonal Events.
-Overall fun gameplay.
-The music in this game fits it very well.
-Loads of achievements.

Cons:
-Boring and hard alone.
-People seem to have problems joining game sessions.
-DLC, which you can't get if you don't buy it, contains weapons with better/different stats and are not only cosmetics.
-Gets repetitive after a few hours.

My opinion:

I like this game but like most other games, it's better when you're 2 (or 6 in this case). I like that Tripwire Interactive adds seasonal events to this game every summer, halloween and christmas, in this period you can unlock characters by completing certain achievement-chains. However, they have a tendency of adding 1 or 2 DLC-packs with these seasonal events, it's cool that they're keeping the game and the community alive by adding new content every now and again but I dislike the fact that you can only obtain weapons with better/different stats by purchasing these DLC-packs.

I love zombie games and I like RPG-games as well, so I think the idea of a zombie shooter with RPG-elements is really cool.

It's a shame that some people experience bugs related to join game sessions, however I've never experienced any of these bugs.
